TopicTitle: Post EVERYTHING you know about the Mun Arch.

Articles.Content: My crew reports it\'s most definately cursed
Here... I got some pictures Of landing My Kaltair By the Arch

Did anybody try flying through it yet?

Yes, someone already did that,
It was syzyzyg or what ever XD
I did it as well strangly, I was doing a weird sling shot to get to minmus, My perigee was really close to the ground, ended up going through the arch :L

Well, I loaded in the rail gun (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=4886.0) and the SUNBEAM laser (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=6452) onto the BigTrak (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=9404.0) and got them to the MÃ¼n. Which was fun let me tell you. The rail gun seriously threw the balance of the craft out. I added the lasers mainly to rebalance it

Anyways, the rail gun and the lasers did nothing to the arch as far as I can tell. I have three screenshots. The first is the impact of the rail gun (you can just see a little cloud of debris, I wasn\'t quite fast enough with the screen capture and it\'s a one-shot deal, so that\'s all you get lol).

The next two are the lasers focusing on the base and then on the arch itself. I held the lasers until they were just about to overheat.

I can confirm that there are indeed 2 arches, both seem to overlook craters if that\'s an indicator of anything. Otherwise without any geologic activity on the Mun it can be assumed that its kerbal-made 8)

I\'ve confirmed the location of the third arch, which is indeed underground.

Actually I can\'t confirm it really as I can\'t SEE underground

But as I\'ve never heard anyone talk about underground monoliths, what I\'ve found must be the arch. My rough (and possibly mistaken) calculations show it to be about 750m below ground. Coordinates in the following spoiler for anyone that wants to take a look at a barren landscape

12.454 South by 140.826 West

One side of one of the arches floats in the air. I\'m not sure about the other.

(Learned by pictures taken by MIEV-2 mission)
I haven\'t noticed the arches levitating, but my 2nd KSC buildings are a few feet in the air. Can that vary from one person\'s game to another? (Attached is my cart partially under the VAB causeway.)

I haven\'t noticed the arches levitating, but my 2nd KSC buildings are a few feet in the air. Can that vary from one person\'s game to another? (Attached is my cart partially under the VAB causeway.)

Part of my second KSC levitate as well, both before and after I added the modded settings.cfg to get faster game.
Well, the only un-posted info I know is that practically only one part of its is possible to rove on with the cart plugin, anywhere else and you just slide off.

This is classified by the KSA. Don\'t tell anyone you saw this and don\'t tell anyone this footage exists.

In all seriousness all I know is

-they couldn\'t have been formed naturally(or if they have been formed naturally, a force unique to the mun is at play...and in only two positions)

-the texture is similar to the ground texture but not the same. Therefor the material is rather new(suggesting the anomaly is of recent creation) or of a material of it\'s own.

-when 2010 music is added they make an interesting plot for a Youtube video.
Ridiculous. I love it.

My crew reports it\'s most definately cursed

oh every rover i shot there blew up or crashed (and i used mechjeb) it is cursed

this is the best shot i got
Wow, I\'ve landed by it a few times and only blown up once (bad piloting). The last time was to try and blow one of them up with rail guns and lasers

i was orbiting the equator, getting ready to make a decent to the equator arch, when i spotted something in the distance from about a 80k orbit.found the second arch, and made my first successful touchdown.

I haven\'t noticed the arches levitating, but my 2nd KSC buildings are a few feet in the air. Can that vary from one person\'s game to another? (Attached is my cart partially under the VAB causeway.)

Yeah when I visited KSC2, my rover drove through the base of the launch pad, it doesn\'t seem to have a collision mesh.

I reached the two surface arches today for the first time. One I reached by driving a BigTrak about 55 km from my primary landing site on the nearside; the other I landed an unmanned probe next to.

The only new information I have to contribute is that at least one of the arches is partially buried. Thanks to a POV glitch I got a glimpse underneath the surface of the Mun, revealing that both sides of the arches extend many meters underground. So it\'s possible they are in fact closed loops.

Passing under the arch in version 0.16 seems to be fatal.... Bill went EVA and never came back.

A well armed Big Track Lander also failed survive the ordeal.

Hmmmm, I wonder if it\'s a recent thing. I know that I crashed a ship near it and was left with the \'eye\' of mechjeb as the only part and was able to roll around and through the arch fine in 0.15. I\'ll have to see if I can recreate that now

Hmmmm, I wonder if it\'s a recent thing. I know that I crashed a ship near it and was left with the \'eye\' of mechjeb as the only part and was able to roll around and through the arch fine in 0.15. I\'ll have to see if I can recreate that now

It is a recent thing. In 0.15.2 i\'ve passed several times under the arches without any event.

(Although shooting at it with a high energy laser might have provoced a response)
well i landed next to the arch and conducted an eva to examine the mysterious arch. unfortunately the kerbonaut did not survive the return trip so we could not retrieve a rock sample

It does not cast a shadow.

(unless your really close)

In my rule-of-thumb book, anything that can\'t cast a proper shadow, or has no reflection is made of pure evil.
Some say that those who travel beneath the arch are sucked through an interdimensional portal.
